0.title: Thoko Tali!: Amarinder's party tweets after Sidhu gets 1-year jail
0.article_body: After Supreme Court sentenced Punjab Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu to one year in jail in a 1988 road rage case, his former party colleague Captain Amarinder Singh's Punjab Lok Congress tweeted, "Thoko Tali! (clap your hands)." It is Sidhu's famous dialogue from a television comedy show. The SC had spared Sidhu a jail term in 2018.

1.title: Russia must not win war, Ukraine must prevail: German Chancellor
1.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Thursday described the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine as the "greatest crisis the EU is facing in its history". Addressing Germany's Parliament, Scholz said, "We...share one goal, Russia must not win this war, Ukraine must prevail." Scholz's remarks came ahead of a special meeting of the European Council over the war in Ukraine.

2.title: 2,000 more paramilitary personnel to be deployed in Punjab: CM Mann
2.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Thursday said about 2,000 more paramilitary personnel will be deployed in the state to boost security. After meeting Union Home Minister Amit Shah, Mann said, "There have been regular inputs that some miscreants are trying to create trouble in Punjab." He added that 10 companies of paramilitary personnel have already reached Punjab.

3.title: 'Anek', 'Article 15' shouldn't be seen with commercial lens: Ayushmann
3.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana said his films 'Anek' and 'Article 15' shouldn't be seen with a commercial lens. "They're films that are very important for society...you can't compare these films with 'Dream Girl' or 'Bala' because they are mass entertainers," the actor added. Speaking about 'Anek', he said, "It's an intelligent film. For this film, you need both brain and heart."

4.title: Russian govt to help McDonald's Russia business owner to set up: Report
4.article_body: Russian government will assist McDonald's Russia business' new owner in setting up, news agency TASS reported quoting Russian Industry and Trade Minister Denis Manturov on Thursday. McDonald's said it will sell its Russia business to its current licensee Alexander Govor. Govor will operate McDonald's restaurants in Russia under a new brand and will retain employees for at least two years.

5.title: Deeply aggrieved: Zepto after delivery boy dies in alleged hit-and-run in Delhi
5.article_body: Ten-minute grocery delivery startup Zepto said it's "deeply aggrieved" by the death of Karan Raju (Zepto delivery partner working with Zypp). Zepto said Karan was hit by a vehicle from behind "in what seems to be a hit-and-run incident in South Delhi". Zepto is giving financial aid of ₹10 lakh and an insurance grant of ₹8 lakh to Karan's family.

6.title: Indians living in SL asked to register details with High Commission
6.article_body: The High Commission of India in Colombo, Sri Lanka, has requested all Indian citizens who are currently living in Sri Lanka to register their details on hcicolombo.gov.in/registration. The High Commission has issued separate registration links for NRIs and students. This comes as Sri Lanka is reeling under an economic crisis, which has triggered a shortage of essential items, including food.

7.title: Right man in right party: Ex-Punjab CM Amarinder as Jakhar joins BJP
7.article_body: Former Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Thursday congratulated ex-Congress leader Sunil Jakhar for joining the BJP. "Right man in the right party," said Singh, who quit Congress and formed his own party last year. He added, "Honest and upright leaders like him [Jakhar] cannot breathe in the Congress anymore."

8.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperature on Thursday released
8.article_body: The IMD has released a list of cities that witnessed the highest maximum temperature on Thursday. Rajasthan's Barmer had the highest maximum temperature at 47.1°C, followed by 46.6°C in Churu and 46.5°C in Bikaner and Pilani. UP's Jhansi recorded 46.3°C and Rajasthan's Ganganagar recorded 46.2°C. Meanwhile, both Nowgong and Jaisalmer recorded 46°C.

9.title: I've asked Akshay if I could buy songs from his collection: Bhushan
9.article_body: T-Series head Bhushan Kumar, speaking about actor Akshay Kumar, has said, "He is very passionate about music. He keeps calling for songs from different music composers, singers, or lyricists." Bhushan revealed Akshay has a "pandora box" of 400-500 different songs. "I once asked him if I could buy some songs from his collection, that's how huge it is," he added.

10.title: Female Afghan TV presenters must cover face on air, says Taliban
10.article_body: Taliban authorities in Afghanistan have asked TV broadcasters to ensure that female presenters on local stations cover their faces when on air, an official said. This comes days after authorities ordered women to cover their faces in public. "Yesterday we met with media officials...they accepted our advice very happily," Akif Mahajar, spokesman for Taliban's Ministry of Vice and Virtue, said.

11.title: Punjab CM Mann meets Amit Shah in Delhi, discusses border security
11.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann met Union Home Minister Amit Shah in Delhi on Thursday and discussed issues, including national security concerns and technology infrastructure needed to enhance border management. Centre will provide 10 companies of security forces to Punjab, Mann said. "We [have] requested anti-drone technology...other matters including...Punjab quota issue were also discussed," he added.

12.title: World's 2nd richest man Bezos shares magazine cover he framed as a 'reminder'
12.article_body: The world's second-richest man Jeff Bezos took to Twitter to share an old magazine cover featuring him, and said, "I have this old 2006 BusinessWeek framed as a reminder." The magazine's cover featuring Bezos was titled, "Amazon's risky bet". Bezos tweeted, "The 'risky bet' that Wall Street disliked was AWS, which generated revenue of more than $62 billion last year."

13.title: Hindi has been our national language, we should respect that: Arjun
13.article_body: Arjun Rampal, talking about the national language debate, said, "Hindi has been our national language...we should respect that." Arjun added Hindi is spoken and understood the most across the country. "But that's not taking away from any other language," he added. This comes after Ajay Devgn-Kiccha Sudeep's Twitter row where Ajay had said that Hindi will remain the national language.

14.title: US town shuts down after its only clerk quits over vacation denial
14.article_body: The US town of Passadumkeag, which has about 350 residents, has effectively shut down until further notice after the town's only clerk quit. Christen Bouchard quit after being denied a two-week vacation because there wasn't anyone to take over during her temporary absence. The town can't issue vehicle registrations or inspect homes, and its office is closed since April 21.

15.title: CPI holds protest against arrest of MP Binoy Viswam in Hyderabad
15.article_body: The Communist Party of India (CPI) protested against the arrest of MP Binoy Viswam in Hyderabad. "After the Telangana government was formed they are trying to sabotage everything by using police power and filing false cases and sending people to jail," CPI state secretary said. Viswam was arrested after he allegedly staged a protest while demanding houses for the poor.

16.title: CBI files FIR against WB Minister Adhikary, daughter over teacher appointment scam
16.article_body: CBI has registered an FIR against West Bengal Minister of State for School Education PC Adhikary and his daughter for failing to appear before it at the set time. Calcutta High Court had directed CBI to interrogate them over alleged appointment of his daughter as a teacher in a state government-aided school. Adhikary had mailed to CBI seeking more time.

17.title: Panvel civic body to set up 5 EV charging stations: Report
17.article_body: The Panvel Municipal Corporation (PMC) has reportedly decided to set up five charging stations to facilitate the charging of electric vehicles. These charging stations are expected to be set up along the expressway and highway. At one charging station, two four-wheelers and two-wheelers can be parked for charging. According to Panvel RTO, 1380 electric vehicles have been registered so far.

18.title: Retired army man found dead in his house in MP's Bhopal
18.article_body: A retired army personnel, identified as Mahendra Singh, was found dead in his house in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, police said. The deceased worked as a security supervisor at MANIT and lived alone, the police said. When the neighbours complained of foul smell, the police reached the deceased's house and found him lying dead on his bed.

19.title: Jeremy Renner shares pic of hanging off a truck in India, praises 'beautiful country'
19.article_body: Jeremy Renner, best known for playing 'Hawkeye' in the 'Avengers' movies, is currently in India. He shared a picture from his trip to India, which shows him hanging off a truck. On Thursday, he shared a selfie from Delhi, apparently from his hotel, and wrote, "Many blessings to you all from this beautiful country and culture."

20.title: Woman spends over ₹23 lakh to watch Depp-Amber trial in person: Report
20.article_body: Johnny Depp's female fan named Ivan De Boer has reportedly spent around $30,000 (₹23 lakh) to attend the actor's defamation trial against Amber Heard in person. "I took...whole year's vacation so I could be here for Depp," Ivan told the People magazine. "I'm the same age as Depp. I'm single, so I do what I want to, basically," she added.

21.title: Man booked for raping his 15-yr-old daughter in Navi Mumbai
21.article_body: Nerul police registered a case against a 42-year-old man for allegedly sexually assaulting his minor daughter repeatedly. Police said the accused ran away after the victim threatened to approach the police. The accused, a native of Jharkhand, was working as a cook in a bungalow in Nerul and brought his 15-year-old daughter here a year ago, they added.

22.title: GT to bat first against RCB, both teams make 1 change each
22.article_body: GT captain Hardik Pandya won the toss and elected to bat first against RCB in their final league stage match in IPL 2022. Both the teams have made one change each to their playing XIs. Alzarri Joseph has been replaced by Lockie Ferguson in GT's playing XI, while Siddarth Kaul has replaced Mohammed Siraj in RCB's playing XI.

23.title: Portugal reports 5 confirmed cases of monkeypox as outbreak spreads
23.article_body: Health officials in Portugal said on Wednesday that five confirmed cases of monkeypox have been reported in men, adding that 15 suspected infections around the capital, Lisbon, are being investigated. This comes as confirmed monkeypox cases have also been found in the UK and US. Symptoms of monkeypox include fever, distinctive bumpy rash on one's face and other body parts.

24.title: PM Modi to attend Quad Summit in Japan on May 24: MEA
24.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will attend the Quad Summit in Tokyo, Japan on May 24, Ministry Of External Affairs Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said. This would be the fourth summit of Quad leaders. PM Modi will have bilateral meetings with his Japanese counterpart Fumio Kishida and US President Joe Biden, Bagchi added.

25.title: Frankfurt beat Rangers to win Europa League, end their 42-year European trophy drought
25.article_body: Eintracht Frankfurt defeated Rangers 5-4 on penalties in the final to win Europa League 2021/22. Before going into penalties, the match had ended in a 1-1 draw with Joe Aribo and Rafael Santos Borré scoring for Rangers and Eintracht Frankfurt, respectively. With the win, Eintracht Frankfurt ended their 42-year European trophy drought.

26.title: Anurag Thakur announces incentive schemes for foreign films shooting in India
26.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur has announced an incentive scheme for audio-visual co-production and shooting of foreign films in India with "a cash incentive of up to 30% with a cap of $260,000". He added that foreign films that employ 15% or more manpower in India while shooting in the country will receive an additional bonus with a cap of $65,000.

27.title: Have not yet taken a decision on joining BJP or AAP: Hardik Patel
27.article_body: After resigning from Congress, Hardik Patel said that he has not yet taken a decision on joining any other political party, be it BJP or AAP. Addressing a press conference, Hardik Patel criticised Congress, saying leaders of the party were biased against the people of Gujarat. "I wasted my three years in this party," Patel said.

28.title: Pichai, Aryabhatta have bigger fans than stars & actors put together: R Madhavan
28.article_body: Actor R Madhavan, who's attending the 75th Cannes Film Festival, on Thursday said, "From Aryabhatta to Sundar Pichai, we've such extraordinary stories as far as science and technology is concerned." He added, "We are not making movies about these people...They have bigger fans than stars and actors put together." Madhavan is making his directorial debut with 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect'.

29.title: Consequences of temper must be borne: SC while sentencing Sidhu to jail
29.article_body: While sentencing Navjot Singh Sidhu in a three-decade-old road rage case, the Supreme Court said, "Tempers may have been lost but then the consequences of the loss of temper must be borne." A 65-year-old man died in the incident. The court noted that Sidhu inflicted the blow to the man who was more than double his age at that time.

30.title: NATO has no plans to place nuclear arms, bases in Finland: PM Marin
30.article_body: NATO hasn't expressed any interest to place nuclear arms and bases in Finland, PM Sanna Marin has said. Marin's comments came after Finland and Sweden jointly submitted their applications to join the military alliance, a decision fuelled by the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Notably, Swedish PM Magdalena Andersson has said that Sweden doesn't want permanent NATO bases on its territory.

31.title: Delhi's Ghazipur slaughterhouse shut for harming environment
31.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has directed the East Delhi Municipal Corporation to hold Delhi's Ghazipur slaughterhouse's operating licence for violation of environmental norms. NGT said the plant will be allowed to operate only after the Central Pollution Control Board and the Delhi Pollution Control Committee certify that the slaughterhouse can be operated as per environment-related rules.

32.title: Pune-based AIT's few students fall sick, institute cites heat as reason
32.article_body: Some students of the Army Institute of Technology (AIT) in Pune complained of dysentery, stomach ache and vomiting from the night of May 14, officials said. The problems could have arisen due to high heat and less water intake, an official statement said. It added that outside food was stopped for two days as a precautionary measure.

33.title: Protect 'Brand Bengaluru': SM Krishna to K'taka CM amid rain havoc
33.article_body: Former Union minister SM Krishna has written a letter to Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai, urging him to take decisive steps to protect Bengaluru's image as recent rainfall created havoc in many areas. "The recent rain related havoc has…posed a threat to 'Brand Bengaluru' image which might also send a wrong message to the potential investors across the world," he wrote.

34.title: Over 7 lakh people in Assam's 29 districts affected by floods
34.article_body: Over seven lakh people have been affected due to floods across Assam's 29 districts, Assam State Disaster Management Authority said. Furthermore, nine people have died so far amid floods in the state, it added. Meanwhile, Assam Cabinet has introduced an emergency flight service between Silchar and Guwahati at subsidised rates amid disrupted rail and road link connectivity in several districts.

35.title: 206 kidney stones removed from 56-year-old man in Hyderabad
35.article_body: As many as 206 kidney stones were removed from a patient in Hyderabad's Aware Gleneagles Global Hospitals. The 56-year-old patient, Veeramalla Ramalakshmaiah, reportedly suffered from severe pain in his left loin due to stones for over six months, which was further aggravated due to soaring temperatures. The surgery lasted for an hour, post which patient recovered well, a doctor said.

36.title: Video shows boxer Musa collapsing during fight before dying of heart attack in Germany
36.article_body: A video showing 38-year-old undefeated boxer Musa Yamak collapsing during a fight before he died due to heart attack in Germany has surfaced online. The video shows referee and other staff rushing to help him as soon as he fell down. His opponent Uganda's Hamza Wandera could be seen standing on the other side of the ring.

37.title: Over 3,000 Char Dham Yatra pilgrims stuck as Yamunotri highway caves in
37.article_body: A 15-metre stretch of Yamunotri Highway between Rana Chatti and Sayana Chatti caved in on Wednesday, following which over 3,000 Char Dham Yatra pilgrims were stranded on both sides. Only smaller vehicles were able to go ahead, officials said. Around 24 buses and over 15 minibuses were stopped and the stranded pilgrims were taken to safe shelters.

38.title: Forest fire breaks out near Delhi's Majnu Ka Tila; 3rd incident in 1 day
38.article_body: A fire broke out in the forest area near North Delhi's Majnu Ka Tila on Thursday, Delhi Fire Services (DFS) said. The department immediately pressed two fire tenders to douse the flames. "After reaching here, we saw that there's a petrol pump where a big accident can happen...We have asked for more vehicles which are coming," a DFS official said.

39.title: IB official dies after falling from stage during security check in Hyd
39.article_body: An Intelligence Bureau (IB) official in Hyderabad died on Wednesday after falling from the stage of an auditorium while reviewing security ahead of Vice-President M Venkaiah Naidu's visit. The 51-year-old was taking photographs of the auditorium. He suffered internal head injuries and was shifted to a hospital where he died.

40.title: Kangana & I go back a long time, we won National Awards together: Arjun
40.article_body: Actor Arjun Rampal, speaking about his 'Dhaakad' co-star Kangana Ranaut, has said, "Kangana and I go back a really long time." "We both won our National Awards together in Delhi, and we kept on meeting each other here and there," he added. Speaking about working with Kangana in 'Dhaakad', Arjun said it was "really fun" working with her.

41.title: Investors lose ₹7 lakh crore as Sensex crashes over 1,400 points
41.article_body: The wealth of investors tumbled by ₹7 lakh crore on Thursday as the market's key indices, Sensex and Nifty, tumbled by more than 2.5%. While the Sensex closed 1,416 points lower to settle at 52,792, the Nifty ended 431 points lower, at 15,809. The key indices fell after an overnight selloff on Wall Street, the worst in two years.

42.title: Sameera Reddy shares pics from when she had postpartum stress, says 'Me at my lowest'
42.article_body: Actress Sameera Reddy took to social media to share pictures from the time she was going through postpartum stress. "The pics I shared in this post [show] me at my lowest. I couldn't feel happy however hard I tried after the birth of my first child," she wrote. "You are not alone," Sameera further wrote in her post.

43.title: Rights groups urge FIFA to compensate Qatar's migrant workers with $440 million
43.article_body: Several rights groups have urged FIFA to compensate Qatar's migrant workers with $440 million for "human rights abuses" allegedly inflicted upon them during the preparations for the 2022 FIFA World Cup. Amnesty International, one of the rights groups, demanded compensation "to remedy the litany of abuses committed since 2010". Notably, a letter was also sent to FIFA President Gianni Infantino.

44.title: Sri Lankan armed forces ended war with LTTE via humanitarian ops: Prez
44.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa said that country's armed forces ended nearly 30-year-long civil war in 2009 with LTTE through "humanitarian operation", adding that there wasn't hatred or anger involved in war. "There's no room for racism or any other form of extremism [here]," he added. Rajapaksa's comments came as country marked 13th anniversary of War Heroes Day on Wednesday.

45.title: Sculptures of Gods, Sheshnag-like structure seen in Gyanvapi Mosque: Advocate
45.article_body: Advocate Ajay Kumar Mishra said that several sculptures of Gods and Goddesses were seen in the Gyanvapi Mosque. "Outside the barricading of the disputed area, the ruins of the old temple were found...In the middle, stone sculptures of Sheshnag and "Nag phan" like patterns were seen," he added. Mishra, who was leading the survey team, was removed by Varanasi court.

46.title: 3 arrested, minor detained for abduction, gangrape of 13-yr-old in Delhi
46.article_body: Police on Wednesday said three persons have been arrested and one minor has been detained in connection with the kidnapping and gangrape of a 13-year-old in Delhi. The victim had left her house on April 24 to buy vegetables when her auto driver took her to Okhla, gave her a spiked drink and gangraped her along with two other boys.

47.title: Assam BJP MLA takes piggyback ride while reviewing flood situation, video surfaces
47.article_body: Assam BJP MLA Sibu Misra, who was in Hojai to review the flood situation on Wednesday, took a piggyback ride to a boat on the back of a flood rescue worker. A video that has surfaced on social media shows the relief worker walking in the water. At least nine people have lost their lives due to the floods.

48.title: 2 men arrested for spying for ISI, sharing pics of Army buildings and vehicles
48.article_body: Punjab Police have claimed to bust a cross-border espionage network by arresting two persons. According to reports, Zaffar Riaz and Mohd Shamshad, who lived in a rented house in Amritsar, captured photographs and videos of the Indian Army buildings and vehicles and shared them with a Pakistan-based intelligence officer. Investigations are being conducted to assess the amount of damage caused.

49.title: Thailand star Cindy recreates Alia's Gangubai Kathiawadi scene, shares video
49.article_body: Thailand star Cindy Bishop recreated Alia Bhatt's white saree look from 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. Taking to Instagram, she shared a video of a scene and wrote, "Beyond...epic sets...captivating scenes [and] stunning performances by Alia and cast, which...fascinated...many of us in Thailand." "This film brings to...forefront the much-contested arguments about prostitution vs sex work," she added.

50.title: ASI shuts Aurangzeb's tomb for 5 days amid row over AIMIM leader's visit
50.article_body: Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) has decided to shut down Mughal emperor Aurangzeb's tomb in Aurangabad for five days amid controversy over AIMIM leader Akbaruddin Owaisi's visit to tomb. The tomb will remain shut to protect law and order situation in Maharashtra, Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said. Notably, Agra Mayor Naveen Jain called for removal of Aurangzeb's plaques from city.

51.title: Africa contained many outbreaks of monkeypox during pandemic: CDC
51.article_body: Several outbreaks of monkeypox in Africa were contained during COVID-19 pandemic, Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) claimed. The outbreaks were seen in DR Congo, Nigeria, Cameroon, and Central African Republic, Africa CDC's Acting Director Ahmed Ouma said. Outbreaks of monkeypox in Europe and US are concerning, Ouma added, saying the agency is in touch with European CDC.

52.title: I evolved as a person from a bus driver's son to a confident actor: Yash
52.article_body: Actor Yash spoke about how he got rid of his inferiority complex and evolved as a person from a son of a bus driver to a confident actor. He said, "The battle you've to fight is within you." "People might term you as a small-town boy and say...your English isn't good...But I feel all...this can be learnt," he added.

53.title: Gajraj to play 70-yr-old man with erectile dysfunction in Imtiaz's Thai Massage
53.article_body: Actor Gajraj Rao will play the role of a 70-year-old man with erectile dysfunction in filmmaker Imtiaz Ali's 'Thai Massage'. Sharing a few stills on Instagram from the film, Gajraj Rao wrote, "The coming of age of a 70-year-old man...Sah Pariwar enjoy karein." In the photos, the senior actor can be seen dressed in checked shirts and mufflers.

54.title: KKR will invest in Rinku Singh in coming years: Brendon McCullum
54.article_body: KKR head coach Brendon McCullum has said that the franchise will invest in their 24-year-old batter Rinku Singh "over the next few years". "We will see him progressing...Not too many people can bat like Rinku did and be able to pull games out of the fire," McCullum said. Rinku scored 40(15), which included four sixes, against LSG on Wednesday.

55.title: BJP running 'Tughlaqi Raj', no one has right to freedom: Mamata
55.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised BJP and said that the party is running 'Tughlaqi Raj' in the country. Praising her party, she said that unlike BJP, TMC is a party of "Maa Maati Manush". "They are running 'Tughlaqi Kand' through...central agency. No one has the right to freedom, BJP has ended all rights," Mamata said in Jhargram district.

56.title: BJP holding meeting as it's scared after Cong's 'Chintan Shivir': Gehlot
56.article_body: Ahead of BJP's high-level meeting in Jaipur, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Thursday said the party is holding the conclave as it's scared after the Congress organised its 'Chintan Shivir'. "They are scared...therefore they are coming here," Gehlot said. He further criticised the saffron party for its agenda of Hindutva, saying BJP is doing politics in the name of Hindus.

57.title: Indonesia to lift palm oil export ban from May 23: Prez Widodo
57.article_body: President Joko Widodo on Thursday said Indonesia's palm oil export ban will be lifted from May 23 following supply improvements. The export ban was imposed by the government on April 28 in order to tame soaring domestic cooking oil prices. The decision was taken considering the welfare of 17 million workers in the palm oil industry, President Widodo said.

58.title: SC delivered justice: Badal as Sidhu gets jail in road rage case
58.article_body: After the Supreme Court sentenced Congress' Navjot Singh Sidhu to one year in jail in a 1988 road rage case in which a man had died, SAD President Sukhbir Singh Badal said, "Supreme Court...delivered justice today." "The [victim's] family had been demanding justice for many years," Badal added. Meanwhile, reacting to SC's order, Sidhu tweeted, "Will submit to...majesty of law."

59.title: Notice served to B'luru clinic over actress Chethana's death after fat removal surgery
59.article_body: The District Health Officer of Bengaluru Urban has served a notice to Dr Shetty's Cosmetic Clinic in connection with 21-year-old Kannada actress Chethana Raj's death after a fat removal surgery. "Shetty's Cosmetic Centre had license only to run a polyclinic and dispensary not for procedure they did. They need to submit a written explanation of this incident," the officer said.

60.title: US special coordinator for Tibet meets Dalai Lama in Himachal
60.article_body: United States' special coordinator for Tibetan issues Uzra Zeya met the Dalai Lama at his official residence in Himachal Pradesh's Dharamshala on Thursday. "I bring greetings from our President and from the American people and the best wishes for your good health," Uzra Zeya told the Dalai Lama. She was accompanied by a US delegation.

61.title: Rowdy sheeter, 3 others arrested for plotting robbery in B'luru
61.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru City Police has arrested a rowdy sheeter and his three accomplices, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Thursday. All the four persons were arrested for conspiracy to commit a robbery in the city, Gupta said. Police have seized lethal weapons from the accused's possession, he added.

62.title: Closest ever images of Sun reveal its south pole and 'solar hedgehog'
62.article_body: The European Space Agency's Solar Orbiter snapped the Sun in March this year during its closest approach to the star. One of the images shows the Sun's south pole as seen by the Solar Orbiter. Another image shows a geyser of hot and cold gas emanating from the Sun's surface in all directions that the scientists dubbed the "solar hedgehog".

63.title: Video of Kartik saying 'Ariana Grande looks like Aishwarya Rai' goes viral
63.article_body: During a recent interaction with YouTuber Tanmay Bhat, actor Kartik Aaryan was shown a picture of Aishwarya Rai, in which her hair was tied up in a high ponytail. Tanmay reacted to the photo and said, "She does look like Ariana Grande." Kartik then replies, "Rather, Ariana looks like Aishwarya Rai." Reacting to Kartik's comment, a user wrote, "Totally yes!!"

64.title: Renault unveils hydrogen-powered prototype SUV
64.article_body: Renault has unveiled a prototype hydrogen fuel cell-powered SUV, called 'Scenic Vision'. The car will not be commercially available before 2030-2032 and a fully electric version will come to the market in 2024, the firm said. It added a 16kW fuel cell will extend the car's range to 800 kilometres without recharging and the battery will be twice as light.

65.title: Double-decker bus hits motorbike in UP's Chitrakoot, 2 dead
65.article_body: Two people died after a motorbike was hit by a double-decker bus near a village in Uttar Pradesh's Chitrakoot. The incident took place at night when the bus was carrying a marriage party, police said. Notably, the deceased, identified as Ramanand (28) and Prem Singh (29), were riding without helmets and were residents of Barwara village, police said.

66.title: Ganguly brought in new players, backed them, doubt if Kohli did that in his tenure: Sehwag
66.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag, in a recent interview, said Sourav Ganguly built a new team under his captaincy, brought in new players and backed them through their highs and lows. "I doubt if Kohli did that in his tenure," he added. Sehwag further said that during Kohli’s captaincy there was a trend to change the team after almost every Test.

67.title: Tata expresses 'grateful appreciation' after SC dismisses Mistry's review plea
67.article_body: Ratan Tata tweeted, "We would like to express our grateful appreciation of the judgement passed and upheld by the Supreme Court today." He added, "It reinforces the value system and the ethics of our judiciary." Tata's tweet came after the Supreme Court dismissed the review petition filed by Cyrus Mistry's Shapoorji Pallonji Group over Mistry's removal as Tata Sons head.

68.title: Mumbai lawyer gets cheated of ₹2.38 lakh while trying to pay electricity bill
68.article_body:
A 63-year-old Mumbai-based woman, who is a lawyer by profession, was allegedly cheated of
₹2.38 lakh by a cyber fraudster who sent her a text message asking her to pay her electricity bill. The woman said that she first received a message and later a call from the fraudster who tricked her into revealing her bank details using AnyDesk application.

69.title: Mozambique declares polio outbreak after Pak-linked strain found
69.article_body: Mozambique declared a polio outbreak on Wednesday after the infection was detected in a child who has been paralysed by the disease. The polio strain was found to be the same that was spreading in Pakistan in 2019. This is the second case to have been detected in southern Africa this year after the one discovered in Malawi in February.

70.title: It was a natural pause: Aishwarya on not having a release since 2018
70.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan spoke about why she doesn't appear regularly in films. She said, "What happened in the last two years was a natural pause that we all took. I've always been someone to keep it real, that's who I am [and] that's my sense of prioritising." "I've never [focused on]...'What...kind of perception it might attract'," she added.

71.title: WHO ignoring requests for observer status at assembly: Taiwan
71.article_body: Taiwan Foreign Ministry said that the World Health Organization (WHO) is "ignoring" its repeated requests to be allowed to attend the World Health Assembly (WHA) as an observer. "The WHO failed to stay neutral and professional," it added. Taiwan is excluded from most global groups due to China's objections, as it considers the island to be one of its provinces.

72.title: 65-yr-old man killed in tiger attack while grazing cattle in UP
72.article_body: A 65-year-old man was attacked and killed by a tiger that strayed from the Katarniya Ghat Wildlife Sanctuary located on the Indo-Nepal border into Bardiya village in UP’s Bahraich. The incident occurred when the man was grazing his cattle. A compensation of ₹5 lakh would be provided to the family of the deceased, an official said.

73.title: Rupee closes at new all-time low of 77.72 against US dollar
73.article_body: The Indian rupee closed at a new all-time low of 77.72 against the US dollar on Thursday. It marked the fifth record weak close for the rupee in the last 10 trading sessions. The Indian rupee's value was weighed down by a marketwide sell-off in equities and foreign fund outflows.

74.title: Believed in Himmatwala as much as I believed in Baahubali: Tamannaah
74.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia has said that she believed in Sajid Khan's 'Himmatwala' as much as she believed in SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali'. "But the one thing about those films is, I don't think I was prepared for either," she added. Tamannaah stated she learned on the job, adding, "That's the beauty of being an actor that you're discovering constantly...you're evolving constantly."

75.title: Schools, colleges to remain shut till May 20 due to floods in Assam's Cachar
75.article_body: The Cachar District Administration has issued an order directing all educational institutions and non-essential private establishments to remain shut till May 20 due to floods and landslides that have recently occurred in Assam. Notably, an Assam State Disaster Management Authority report revealed that 1.19 lakh people in the Cachar district have been affected by the natural calamity.

76.title: Minor alleges she was filmed at Jodhpur club's washroom, moves HC
76.article_body: A minor girl in Rajasthan's Jodhpur has approached the High Court alleging police inaction into her complaint that a person secretly filmed her in washroom of a club. The girl said she is not a member of the club and had gone there with a friend in April. When police were called, the club allegedly asked them to go back.

77.title: Pune residents to now get single helpline emergency number 112
77.article_body: Emergency helpline numbers for contacting police, women's helpline and children's helpline in Pune will now be integrated into a single number. The previous numbers 100, 1091 and 1098 for respective departments will now be scrapped and only the new helpline number 112 will be available, Pune Police tweeted. The decision was reportedly made to provide joint assistance to various departments.

78.title: Man electrocuted to death in B'luru, 4th such case in over a month
78.article_body: A 40-year-old man died of electrocution after coming in contact with a damaged wire in Bengaluru. The deceased was reportedly cutting chicken using a cleaning machine when the incident occurred in a butcher shop. He didn't notice that the machine's wire was damaged and got electrocuted. This is reportedly the fourth case of electrocution in over a month in Bengaluru.

79.title: Universities shouldn't become spaces for ideological battles: Amit Shah
79.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said universities shouldn't become wrestling grounds for ideological battles. "Universities should become platform for exchange of views and not...spaces for ideological conflict," Shah said while speaking at an event hosted by Delhi University. He also said that though some people call India a country of problems, we have potential of finding solutions

80.title: Parents of 6-year-old girl who was shot in Noida donate her organs, save 5 lives
80.article_body: Parents of a six-year-old girl, Roli Prajapati, who was shot by unidentified assailants in Noida, have donated her organs which saved five lives, reported ANI. Roli was shot in her head after which the doctors declared her brain dead. Roli's father Harnarayan Prajapati said, "We decided she would be alive in other people's lives and give others reason to smile."

81.title: Apple stops storing card information for customers in India
81.article_body: Apple has decided to stop storing credit and debit card information for Indian customers making payments for its services. The decision was made in light of the Reserve Bank of India's new card storage guidelines which will be effective shortly. Apple said the unified payments interface or net banking can be used by customers for these payments to avoid interruptions.

82.title: New York probes social media platforms Buffalo shooting suspect used
82.article_body: Social media platforms believed to be used by Buffalo mass shooting suspect are being investigated by New York state authorities. The probe will focus on platforms like Amazon-owned Twitch, Discord, online message boards 4chan and 8chan and other platforms "the shooter used to amplify his attack". Twitch had detected the shooter's live stream within two minutes of the violence beginning.

83.title: Greater Chennai Corporation staffer dies by suicide at office building
83.article_body: A 54-year-old Greater Chennai Corporation staffer allegedly died by suicide on the terrace of an annexure building on Wednesday, an official said. "Office works of the revenue and health department were taking place...A staff of our department found him hanging on the terrace and we alerted the police," official added. Police have registered a suspicious death case, the official stated.

84.title: In Gujarat, it's not only Hardik who is angry with Cong: Hardik Patel
84.article_body: In Gujarat, it’s not only Hardik Patel who is angry with the Congress, Patel, who resigned from the party on Wednesday, said. "There are many leaders and legislators in Gujarat who use Congress," Patel added. "Sitting in power and praising the party does not mean that the party can make them the CM," Patel stated.

85.title: 38-yr-old boxer Musa dies of heart attack after collapsing during match in Germany
85.article_body: Undefeated boxer Musa Yamak has died at the age of 38 after collapsing in the ring on Saturday while facing Uganda's Hamza Wandera in Munich. "We lost our compatriot Musa Askan Yamak, a boxer from Alucra, who won European and Asian championships, at a young age after a heart attack," Turkish official Hasan Turan announced.

86.title: Will help Sweden, Finland if they're attacked before joining NATO: Poland
86.article_body: Poland has said it will help Sweden and Finland if they are attacked before their NATO membership is finalised. "I want to make it clear that in the event of an attack on Sweden or Finland during their accession [process], Poland will come to their aid," said Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki. Sweden and Finland have formally applied for NATO membership.

87.title: 3 parakeets, over 120 other birds rescued from illegal sale bid in Pune
87.article_body: Pune City Police on Tuesday seized three exotic parakeets and over 120 other caged birds from a person in a crackdown over their illegal sale. On receiving a tip-off, police officials raided the accused's residence in the city's Ganesh Peth area and found these birds. The accused has been arrested and subsequently charged under the Wildlife Protection Act.

88.title: HC sets aside Delhi's doorstep ration delivery scheme, says it didn't have LG's nod
88.article_body: Delhi High Court on Thursday set aside the Aam Aadmi Party-led Delhi government's doorstep ration delivery scheme. The scheme did not have the approval of the Lieutenant Governor and the grains provided by the Centre cannot be used for this scheme, the court said. HC was hearing a plea by the Delhi Sarkari Ration Dealers Sangh challenging the scheme.

89.title: Ex-US Prez Bush mistakenly condemns 'brutal Iraq invasion' in Ukraine speech
89.article_body:
Former US President George W Bush mistakenly condemned the "brutal, unjustified invasion of Iraq" during a speech before correcting himself to say he was denouncing Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
Bush, who's 75, jokingly blamed the mistake on his age. Back in 2003, Bush announced an invasion of Iraq, claiming that the country was harbouring weapons of mass destruction and terrorists.

90.title: Big B, Rajesh Khanna's Anand gets a remake, fan says 'Don't spoil the film'
90.article_body: Late actor Rajesh Khanna and actor Amitabh Bachchan's film 'Anand' is being remade by original producer N.C. Sippy's grandson Sameer Raj Sippy and Vikram Khakhar. Speaking about remaking the original classic, producer Sameer Raj Sippy said that stories like these need to be narrated to the new generation. Reacting to the news, one user wrote, "Please don't spoil the film."

91.title: Sensex falls over 1,400 points to close at 52,792; TCS, Infosys shares tank 5%
91.article_body: The Sensex tanked 1,416 points on Thursday to close at 52,792, while the Nifty tanked 431 points to close at 15,809. The benchmark indices fell following heavy losses on Wall Street overnight. The IT stocks were the worst hit, with the shares of TCS and Infosys tanking by more than 5%.

92.title: Pope's 'need a tequila for my knee pain' video goes viral
92.article_body: A video of Pope Francis joking with Mexican seminarians about needing tequila to deal with pain in his knee has gone viral on social media. Pope Francis has been suffering from strained ligaments in his right knee for months and has been using a wheelchair. Seminarians promised to bring Pope Francis a bottle of tequila.

93.title: Gucci, Adidas face backlash for over ₹1 lakh umbrella that doesn't stop rain
93.article_body: Gucci and Adidas are facing backlash on social media over an umbrella that the companies are selling for 11,000 yuan (more than ₹1 lakh) in China. Gucci's China website states that the umbrella is "not waterproof and is meant for sun protection or decorative use". People posted tweets like, "You gotta be joking" and "Why make it then?"

94.title: SC to not review verdict on removal of Cyrus Mistry as Tata Sons head
94.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday dismissed a plea filed by the Shapoorji Pallonji Group seeking to review the court's earlier order approving the removal of Cyrus Mistry as Executive Chairman and Director of Tata Sons. The March 2021 order of the Supreme Court had overturned the NCLAT order which had reinstated Mistry as Tata Sons' Executive Chairman and Director.

95.title: Depp held dog out of car window & joked to put it in microwave: Amber's sister
95.article_body: Amber Heard's sister Whitney Henriquez alleged that Johnny Depp held their dog out of a car window in an incident back in 2013. "I was scared because...I knew how inebriated he was...the dog was...small," she said. She recalled Depp laughing after bringing the dog back in. "Then he made some joke about putting the dog in the microwave," she added.

96.title: Prof Karbhari Vishwanath takes additional charge of SPPU VC in Pune
96.article_body: Professor Karbhari Vishwanath Kale has been handed over the additional charge of the Vice-Chancellor of Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) as Professor Nitin Karmalkar's tenure ended. Professor Kale is the Vice-Chancellor of Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar Technological University (BATU) in Maharashtra's Raigad district. He said, "I'll try to give maximum time as per the need in both the universities."

97.title: Russia sacked top commanders over Ukraine war failures: UK
97.article_body: The UK Defence Ministry said Russia has fired senior military commanders for underperforming in the Ukrainian war. Vice Admiral Igor Osipov, who commanded the Black Sea Fleet, was likely sacked following the sinking of the Moskva cruiser in April, it added. Russian Chief of General Staff Valeriy Gerasimov has likely lost Russian President Vladimir Putin's "confidence", the ministry said.

98.title: LIC share price down 11% from IPO price, falls for 3rd straight day
98.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) share price fell 4.12% to ₹840.25 on Thursday, taking the total drop in LIC's share price to 11.45% from its IPO issue price. The insurer's shares were listed on the stock market on Tuesday at a price of ₹867, against the IPO issue price of ₹949. The ₹21,000-crore public issue was oversubscribed nearly three times.

99.title: Pic shows Sidhu riding an elephant to protest rising prices before 1-yr jail verdict
99.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu rode an elephant in Punjab to protest against rising prices. Sharing pictures of the protest, Sidhu wrote, "Inflation devalues money of Farmers, Labourers, Middle class families, while earnings remain same." Sidhu was protesting before the Supreme Court sentenced him to one-year rigorous imprisonment in a three-decade-old road rage case.

100.title: Congress sidelined objectivity & prioritised subjectivity: Nadda
100.article_body: The Congress party is neither national, Indian nor democratic, BJP National President JP Nadda said on Thursday. "It (Congress) has reduced to 'bhai-behen' (brother-sister) party," Nadda added. "What has shrunk Congress is their activities. They sidelined objectivity and prioritised subjectivity...Such parties are BJP's threats. We are fighting them," Nadda stated.

101.title: 22-yr-old man booked under POCSO for raping 17-yr-old girl in Pune
101.article_body: A 22-year-old man was booked under the POCSO Act for allegedly raping and impregnating a 17-year-old girl in Pune. The girl's mother alleged that the victim was found 21 weeks pregnant after she complained of stomach ache to her, police said. The FIR has been lodged at the Bibvewadi Police Station.

102.title: Will submit to the majesty of law: Sidhu on being sentenced to 1-yr jail in road rage case
102.article_body: After being sentenced to one-year rigorous imprisonment by Supreme Court in a 1988 road rage case in which a man had died, Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu tweeted, "Will submit to the majesty of law." In 2018, the apex court had found Sidhu guilty of "voluntarily causing hurt" to a 65-year-old man, however, it had spared him a jail term.

103.title: We’re taking collective resolve to build new forward-looking India: PM
103.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said that collective efforts are being taken to build a new India. "Today we are taking a collective resolve, making efforts to build a new India whose identity is new, forward-looking and traditions are ancient and (to) move ahead by taking both new thinking and age-old culture together," PM Modi added while addressing 'Yuva Shivir'.

104.title: With no fatalities for a year, Gurugram's Eklavya Chowk out of 'black spots' list
104.article_body: Gurugram's Eklavya Chowk, formerly known as Hero Honda Chowk, was removed from the 'black spots' lists after no road fatalities were reported at this junction from April 2021 to April 2022. Gurugram traffic police implemented road safety measures at this Chowk after it was categorised under 'black spots' area in the city. 'Black spots' is referred to accident-prone locations.

105.title: Karnataka SSLC Class 10 board results declared, 145 students score 100% marks
105.article_body: The Karnataka Secondary Education Examination Board on Thursday announced the Class 10 SSLC results. As many as 85.63% of over eight lakh students have cleared the exams. Out of this, 145 students have secured 100% marks and 1.18 lakh students have got Grade A+. The pass percentage for girls was recorded at 90.29%, while it was 81.3% for boys.

106.title: Massive fire breaks out in Delhi's Bawana, 17 fire tenders reach spot
106.article_body: A massive fire broke out in a manufacturing unit of a factory in Delhi's Bawana Industrial Area on Thursday. Delhi Fire Services Director Atul Garg said a call about the fire was received at 11:45 am, following which 17 fire tenders were rushed to the spot. The cause of the fire is not yet known and rescue operation is underway.

107.title: 1 killed, 6 injured as fire breaks out at electric items factory in Delhi
107.article_body: At least one person died and six others were injured on Thursday after a fire broke out at a factory in Delhi's Mustafabad area, officials said. Seven fire tenders were rushed to the spot, officials added. "The fire broke out on the first floor of a factory manufacturing electric items," Fire Department Director Atul Garg said.

108.title: We are seeing transmission among men having sex with men: WHO on monkeypox
108.article_body: With health authorities in North America and Europe detecting dozens of suspected or confirmed cases of monkeypox since early May, WHO has warned that monkeypox may spread through sexual contact. "We are seeing transmission among men having sex with men," said WHO Assistant Director-General Dr Soce Fall. "This is new information we need to investigate properly," Fall added.

109.title: Teacher assaults 18-year-old student over fake social media profile in Pune
109.article_body: An 18-year-old student was assaulted by his teacher and associates at a school in Pune after the former allegedly created a fake social media profile of the teacher. The student had allegedly posted some pornographic text on the profile as well, police said. Notably, the lady teacher has been booked under Section 352 of the IPC.

110.title: Karnataka to get AIIMS, assures Health Minister Mandaviya
110.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has assured the Karnataka government that an AIIMS will be established in the state. The assurance was given during Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar's meeting with Mandaviya, according to a report. The move will greatly benefit the state and further enhance the state's health and medical education, said Sudhakar.

111.title: Video of man laughing uncontrollably during Amber Heard-Depp's trial goes viral
111.article_body: Recently, a video has gone viral online where a court observer couldn't control his laughter during the Johnny Depp and Amber Heard's defamation trial. The video is from Tuesday when Amber was being questioned about her allegations of assault against ex-husband Depp. The man walked out of the courtroom after multiple objections from Depp's attorney Camille Vasquez.

112.title: Owaisi was mum when 2 mosques were demolished in Hyd: Amit Malviya
112.article_body: BJP's Amit Malviya criticised AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi over his remarks on Gyanvapi mosque case and said that he is "communalising" the issue. Owaisi didn't utter a word when two mosques in Hyderabad were demolished to build Secretariat, Malviya added. "Owaisi is not just a communal bigot but a hypocrite who peddles lies planted with fascist media," he further said.

113.title: He mocked Hindu 'aastha': BJP on Akhilesh's remark on temples
113.article_body: Reacting to SP chief Akhilesh Yadav's remark on temples, BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla said, "Akhilesh Yadav, who claims that Shri Krishna comes in his dreams, has mocked the Hindu aastha (faith)." Poonawalla's statement comes after the ex-UP CM said, "Just by placing a rock, a red flag under a pipal tree it becomes a temple in the Hindu religion."

114.title: Andhra man looking for wife stabs mother-in-law to death
114.article_body: A man looking for his wife, who had left him months ago, allegedly stabbed his mother-in-law to death in Andhra Pradesh's Kakinada district. The accused, identified as Ramesh, killed the victim after he couldn't find his wife at her place. Ramesh's wife, who was away studying in Hyderabad, had left him as he doubted her, according to police.

115.title: Thieves break open ATM using gas cutters in Virar; steal ₹17 lakh
115.article_body: Unidentified thieves allegedly broke open an ATM using gas cutters and stole ₹17 lakh in Phoolpada in Virar East on Wednesday, a report stated. The incident came to light when locals saw the damaged ATM and informed the police about the matter. Meanwhile, police have launched an investigation and are examining CCTV footage of the area to arrest the accused.

116.title: Hyderabad auto driver sentenced to life imprisonment for wife's murder
116.article_body: An auto driver was sentenced to life imprisonment for murdering his wife by Hyderabad's LB Nagar court. The convict, Ramavath Sreenu (43), was found guilty of murdering his wife over an argument at their home in a Ranga Reddy district's village in March 2021. Notably, Sreenu was in a drunken state when he attacked his wife, the court said.

117.title: Tesla vehicle crash that killed three under probe in US
117.article_body: The US NHTSA is investigating a crash involving a Tesla that may have been operating in Autopilot during a crash that killed three people. The vehicle had hit a curb and slammed into construction equipment. This is one of 35 crashes under investigation by NHTSA involving Tesla vehicles in which its Autopilot was suspected of being used since 2016.

118.title: Follow rules or leave India: Government to VPN providers
118.article_body: VPN service providers that are not ready to comply with the new guidelines have the only option to exit from India, MoS for Electronics and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said. "If you don't have the logs, start maintaining the logs. If you are a VPN that wants to hide...then frankly you have no other opportunity but to pull out," he said.

119.title: Pune's Ashok Dyalchand nominated for World's Children's Prize award for decade
119.article_body: Pune resident Ashok Dyalchand has been nominated for the World's Children's Prize Decade Child Rights Hero award which is given by the World's Children's Prize Foundation. The 74-year-old activist is among the eight nominees, including Ghana's Kofi Annan and Pakistan's Malala Yousafzai, selected for the award. Notably, Ashok campaigns against child marriages through his institute in India.

120.title: Goa-bound SpiceJet flight returns to Pune following technical glitch
120.article_body: A Goa-bound SpiceJet aircraft, which took off from Pune's Lohegaon airport on Wednesday, returned to the city shortly after takeoff following technical glitch mid-air. The flight, which took off at 12:05 pm from Pune, landed back safely at the city's airport, the airline's spokesperson said. The cause of the glitch, however, has not yet been confirmed by the airline.

121.title: BJP 'misusing' central agencies: Mamata over SSC recruitment scam
121.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday accused the BJP of "misusing" central agencies for settling political scores amid the irregularities in SSC appointments. "If someone has committed any wrong...then law will take its own course," Banerjee said, claiming there were many discrepancies in government recruitment during the erstwhile Left Front regime, details of which she would "reveal soon".

122.title: In Bangladesh, people compare me to Bradman when I score a century: Mushfiqur Rahim
122.article_body: Mushfiqur Rahim, who became the first Bangladesh batter to reach 5,000 Test runs, said in Bangladesh, people compare him to Don Bradman when he scores a century. "But...when I don't score runs...I feel like digging a hole for myself," he added, referring to the criticism he faces. "This is becoming a culture...so the younger players need the support," Rahim stated.

123.title: Navjot Singh Sidhu gets 1-year jail in 3-decade-old road rage case in which a man died
123.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday sentenced Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu to one year in jail in a three-decade-old road rage case in which a man was killed. The court delivered its order on the review petition filed by victim's family. The former cricketer had argued that there was "ambiguity" regarding the actual cause of death of the victim.

124.title: 55 space startups have registered with ISRO in 2 yrs: Govt
124.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh has announced that 55 registered startup proposals were approved in the last two years under ISRO's decision to open up its services and partnerships to the private sector. He expects at least another nine proposals to be completed in 2022-23. He also announced that 75 students' satellites are set to be launched this year.

125.title: Bengaluru's RBD layout to get new drain to flush out rainwater
125.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike will soon construct a drain on a public-private partnership model to carry rainwater from Rainbow Drive (RBD) layout to Sarjapur culvert, Mahadevapura MLA Aravind Limbavali said, visiting the rain-affected area. Residents of RBD layout had written to Limbavali on May 10, seeking a solution to the recurrent flooding problems in the area during the rainy season.

126.title: Man gives triple talaq to Chhattisgarh woman over phone
126.article_body: A woman was allegedly given triple talaq in Chhattisgarh by her husband over the phone for purportedly not giving birth to a child. A case has been registered in the matter. "She was tortured by her husband and father-in-law for not giving birth to a child," Bhaskar Sharma, SHO, Kunkuri, said. The woman was staying at her maternal home.

127.title: CARS24 fires 600 employees citing 'poor performance'
127.article_body: Pre-owned cars platform CARS24 on Thursday said that around 600 of its employees have been let go based on their "poor performance" and not owing to any "cost cuts". The company said, "This is business as usual as these are performance-linked exits that happen every year." The company also said that it's in the process of hiring more people globally.

128.title: 14-year-old boy arrested for raping woman with special needs in Pune
128.article_body: A 14-year-old boy has been arrested for allegedly raping a 23-year-old woman with special needs in Pune's Pimpri Chinchwad. "The teenager suspect raped the woman on two occasions, on May 16 and 18, when her family members were not home," a police officer said. The boy will be produced before the Juvenile Justice Board for further action, the officer added.

129.title: China eases COVID-19 test rules for US, other countries
129.article_body: China has relaxed COVID-19 testing requirements for travellers from some countries, including US, Canada, UAE, Serbia and Bangladesh. Travellers from the US will no longer need an RT-PCR test seven days before flying, according to the Chinese embassy in the US. They will, however, still have to take two RT-PCR tests within 48 or 24 hours of their flights.

130.title: J&K Police arrest 5 for terror attack on wine shop in Baramulla
130.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir Police on Thursday said they have arrested four terrorists and one LeT associate in connection with the terror attack on a wine shop in Baramulla. Police also recovered five pistols, 23 grenades and other explosives from the accused. According to IGP (Kashmir) Vijay Kumar, this terror module was involved in several incidents in the Baramulla area.

131.title: Former Punjab Congress president Sunil Jakhar joins BJP
131.article_body: Senior Congress leader and former chief of Punjab Pradesh Congress Committee (PPCC) Sunil Jakhar on Thursday joined BJP in presence of party president JP Nadda in Delhi. He quit Congress during a Facebook live broadcast on Saturday. Jakhar resigned weeks after party leadership had issued him a show-cause notice over his criticism of former Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi.

132.title: UP court allows lawsuit seeking removal of Shahi Idgah Mosque near Krishna Janmabhoomi
132.article_body: A court in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura on Thursday allowed a lawsuit seeking removal of the Shahi Idgah Masjid from the Krishna Janmabhoomi, informed lawyer Hari Shankar Jain to PTI. The lawsuit seeks the removal of the 17th century Shahi Idgah Masjid from the Katra Keshav Dev Temple, claiming the mosque has been built at the birthplace of Lord Krishna.

133.title: Few people are using it to settle personal scores: Gulshan on nepotism debate
133.article_body: After Zoya Akhtar’s ‘The Archies’ reignited nepotism debate, actor Gulshan Devaiah shared his opinion on it. He tweeted, “The nepotism debate harnesses the angst...many have from within and outside the Hindi entertainment industry to serve the interests of a few who use it to settle personal scores.” “Film production is a private business. It’s not based on merit,” Gulshan added.

134.title: 19-yr-old who tracks Musk's jet claims he has found Zuckerberg's new aircraft
134.article_body: Jack Sweeney, the 19-year-old who tracks Elon Musk's jet, on Wednesday tweeted, "We've found Mark Zuckerberg's jet N68885. Numerous trips point it being his." Sweeney shared a picture of the aircraft. In February, Sweeney began tracking and sharing updates on what he said was Zuckerberg's private jet. In April, he said the aircraft was no longer being used by Zuckerberg.

135.title: IMD issues orange alert in 12 of 14 districts in Kerala amid heavy rains
135.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert in 12 of 14 districts in Kerala amid heavy rains. The alert was issued in all districts except Thiruvananthapuram and Kollam for Thursday. The cyclonic circulation over northern Tamil Nadu and adjoining areas would lead to isolated very heavy rainfall in several parts of Kerala, the state Disaster Management Authority said.

136.title: Sri Lanka CID interrogates 4 MPs over violence during protests
136.article_body: Sri Lanka Police's Criminal Investigation Department (CID) on Wednesday questioned four Members of Parliament (MPs) over the violence amid protests owing to the economic crisis. Many protesters were allegedly attacked by government supporters in Colombo. The CID recorded statements of ex-ministers Rohitha Abeygunawardena and CB Rathnayake and MPs Sahan Pradeep and Sanjeeva Edirimanna.

137.title: Getty Images to launch NFTs derived from its library of 465 mn images
137.article_body: Getty Images has entered into an agreement with Candy Digital to develop a diverse portfolio of NFT products and collections. The NFTs will be derived from the platform's library of "more than 465 million images", including over 135 million analogue images from Getty Images' photographic archive. Many of the analogue archival photographs have never been seen before by the public.

138.title: No improvement in J&K's security after Article 370 abrogation: Omar Abdullah
138.article_body: National Conference Vice President Omar Abdullah on Wednesday said there has been no improvement in the security situation in Jammu and Kashmir following the abrogation of Articles 370 and 35A. While reacting to the targeted killings in the union territory, the former J&K CM said, "In this week, three such killings took place. After every few weeks, this phenomenon restarts."

139.title: Speak truth in Cong and big leaders will defame you: Hardik Patel
139.article_body: A day after resigning from Congress, Hardik Patel criticised the party and said that the strategy of big leaders in Congress is to defame the one who speaks the truth. "There are discussions in party that people will vote for Congress when they get bored," he added. "I decided to leave party not with sadness but courage," Hardik further said.

140.title: Doctor arrested for running sex determination centre in Ludhiana
140.article_body: An Ayurvedic lady doctor was arrested on Wednesday for allegedly running an illegal sex determination centre in Ludhiana's Rishi Nagar. A raid was conducted following complaints that people from across Punjab and Haryana were getting sex detection tests done at the centre, health department officials said. The doctor had been running the centre for around one-and-a-half years, officials stated.

141.title: US charges 1 American, 4 Chinese intel officers with spying
141.article_body: The US charged an American citizen and four Chinese intelligence officers with spying on Chinese dissidents, human rights leaders, and pro-democracy activists residing in the country. American citizen, Wang Shujun, was arrested on March 16 and will be arraigned at a later date, but the four officials of China's Ministry of State Security remain at large, US Justice Department said.

142.title: J&K separatist leader Yasin Malik convicted in terror funding case in Delhi
142.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir separatist leader Yasin Malik has been convicted in 2017 terror funding case by an NIA court in Delhi after he pleaded guilty, ANI reported. The court also sought an affidavit from Malik regarding his financial assessment and asked NIA to submit a report related to his financial assessment. Argument on sentence will take place on May 25.

143.title: Ambala man kills 52-yr-old neighbour with hammer following argument
143.article_body: A 52-year-old woman was allegedly murdered by her neighbour after she asked him to repair his shed in Ambala’s Saha town on Wednesday. According to the deceased woman’s son, the 28-year-old accused hit the victim’s head with a hammer following an altercation with her regarding the shed. The accused managed to escape.

144.title: China building 'larger' bridge on Pangong Tso lake; satellite image released
144.article_body: China is constructing a "larger" second bridge on Pangong Tso lake which is capable of carrying military vehicles and armoured columns, according to satellite imagery and people familiar with the development. The new bridge is being built from both sides simultaneously. The Pangong Tso has witnessed tensions between India and China since May 2020.

145.title: How can RCB qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs?
145.article_body: Fifth-placed RCB will face GT in IPL 2022 tonight. RCB have the worst net run-rate among teams still in contention for playoffs spots. RCB will go fourth on the table with a win over GT. However, they'd need MI to defeat DC to advance. If DC defeat MI, RCB would all likely fail to qualify due to inferior net run-rate.

146.title: It's a natural geologic feature: NASA after pic of 'door' on Mars goes viral
146.article_body: After a pic appearing to show a "door" on Mars went viral, NASA's Curiosity Rover tweeted "Some of you have noticed this image I took...Sure, it may look like a tiny door, but really, it's a natural geologic feature!" "It may just look like a door because your mind is trying to make sense of the unknown," it wrote.

147.title: Only Deepika & I were in sarees at Cannes, attracted a lot of attention: Namita
147.article_body: Actress-producer Namita Lal spoke about her experience of visiting the Cannes Film Festival. She said, "The red carpet was just amazing." Speaking about meeting Deepika Padukone, Namita said, "Deepika was dressed in an amazing saree and was looking stunning. I was in a saree too...We were the only two people in a saree and we attracted a lot of attention."

148.title: J&K govt creates ₹500 cr Film Development Fund for 5 yrs
148.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir government has created Film Development Fund (FDF) of ₹500 crore to be payable in next five years to financially support the development of a vibrant film ecosystem in the valley. According to the Film Policy, the amount will be used for disbursement of subsidies to eligible beneficiaries or film-makers who have applied for the same.

149.title: Rinku Singh tears up as KKR lose to LSG by 2 runs, pics go viral
149.article_body: KKR's Rinku Singh teared up after his team lost to LSG by two runs and failed to qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs. Needing 21 runs to win off the last over, Rinku slammed 18 runs on the first four deliveries before getting caught out on the fifth ball. LSG dismissed Umesh Yadav on the last ball to win the match.

150.title: SC grants interim bail to SP leader Azam Khan in cheating case
150.article_body: Supreme Court has granted interim bail to jailed Samajwadi Party (SP) leader Azam Khan in a cheating case citing "unusual facts" presented before it. SC directed Khan to apply for regular bail before the concerned court within a period of two weeks. The case is related to alleged land grabbing and forgery related to a school in Uttar Pradesh's Rampur.

151.title: Upset over UP govt's order, Mathura lawyers observe strike
151.article_body: After the Uttar Pradesh government issued an order directing all district magistrates to take action against lawyers creating lawlessness in the state's district courts, the lawyers in Mathura observed a strike on Wednesday. The lawyers abstained from work due to the derogatory language allegedly used in the order against the lawyers' community, Bar Association President Ajeet Teharia said.

152.title: Bezos' Blue Origin delays 5th crewed spaceflight over technical issues
152.article_body: Jeff Bezos-owned Blue Origin delayed its fifth crewed spaceflight due to technical issues. The launch was scheduled for May 20. "During our final vehicle check-outs, we observed one of New Shepard's back-up systems was not meeting our expectations for performance," the firm said. Blue Origin's fourth flight landed successfully in March after a 10-minute journey to the edge of space.

153.title: Auto driver killed, woman passenger injured in hit-and-run case in Bandra
153.article_body: A 30-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was killed and a woman passenger travelling in his vehicle was injured after a heavy vehicle hit the three-wheeler in Mumbai's Bandra (West). The incident took place on Tuesday night. While the auto driver's body was found lying on the road in a decapitated state, the injured woman had left the spot in another auto-rickshaw.

154.title: Aurangzeb's tomb shut for 5 days to maintain law and order: Maha Deputy CM
154.article_body: Mughal emperor Aurangzeb's tomb in Aurangabad will remain closed for five days to ensure that the law and order situation in Maharashtra does not get affected, Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said. This comes after a mosque committee in the area tried to lock the place. Notably, Maharashtra Navnirman Sena spokesperson Gajanan Kale had said that the tomb should be destroyed.

155.title: India has become third largest startup ecosystem globally: PM Modi
155.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi in his address to the Yuva Shivir in Gujarat praised India's progress, saying, "Today, India has become third largest startup ecosystem in the world." He also praised India's participation in tackling worldwide challenges. "Today, we are working to build a new India which has a new forward-looking identity, but maintains its ancient traditions," he added.

156.title: 100 red sandalwood logs seized in Andhra Pradesh, 6 smugglers arrested
156.article_body: Andhra Pradesh's Kadapa Police on Wednesday arrested six people for illegally smuggling red sandalwood logs. About 100 logs of red sandalwood weighing 2 tonnes were seized from the accused, said Kadapa Superintendent of Police (SP) Anburajan. According to police, the apprehended persons were involved in illegally transporting red sanders from Andhra Pradesh to Chennai.

157.title: Yogi Cabinet accepts proposal to stop grants to new madrasas in UP
157.article_body: Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh Cabinet has accepted a proposal to stop grants to any new madrasas in the state. The old madrasas getting the funds would continue to do so. "The idea is to focus on quality than quantity...we plan to focus on the quality of the existing ones," UP Minister of State for Minority Welfare Danish Azad Ansari said.

158.title: US embassy reopens in Ukraine's Kyiv after nearly 3 months
158.article_body: The US embassy resumed its operations after nearly three months in war-torn Ukraine's Kyiv on Wednesday. The consular operations, however, won't start immediately and a no-travel advisory issued earlier will remain in place, said an official. "We stand proudly with the government and people of Ukraine as they bravely defend their country," said US Secretary of State Antony Blinken.

159.title: Japan to double fiscal support for Ukraine to $600 million
159.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida said the country will double its fiscal support for Ukraine to $600 million in a coordinated move with World Bank to back the country's near-term fiscal necessities damaged by Russia's invasion. "Our country stands with Ukraine," Kishida added. Japan, a member of the G7, had previously announced $300 million in loans to Ukraine in April.

160.title: N Korea has completed preparations for nuclear test, waiting for best moment: S Korea
160.article_body: North Korea has completed preparations for a nuclear test and is seeking the best moment to carry it out, South Korean lawmaker Ha Tae-keung said citing information from the national spy agency. Earlier, US said it believes there is a "genuine possibility" that North Korea could conduct a nuclear test while President Joe Biden is on his Asia trip.

161.title: Virat Kohli gifts Rashid Khan his bat ahead of their match, Rashid shares video
161.article_body: GT vice-captain Rashid Khan took to Instagram to share a video of him with RCB's Virat Kohli after the latter gifted him his bat ahead of their IPL 2022 clash. "Always a pleasure meeting you...Thank you for the gift," Rashid wrote. Commenting on Rashid's post, SRH pacer Fazalhaq Farooqi wrote, "Two kings of cricket." Meanwhile, presenter Erin Holland wrote, "Superstars."

162.title: Stop printing textbooks with RSS founder's talk: Siddaramaiah to K'taka CM
162.article_body: Reacting to reports of inclusion of RSS founder KB Hedgewar's speech in Karnataka school textbooks, Congress leader Siddaramaiah told Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai to immediately stop the printing of the textbooks. He further asked Bommai to take decision in this regard after discussions with intellectuals and experts. "Do not politicise education for selfish reasons," the ex-Karnataka CM added.

163.title: SC asks UP court not to proceed with Gyanvapi Mosque case today, will hear matter tomorrow
163.article_body: The Supreme Court has asked the trial court in Varanasi not to proceed with the Gyanvapi Mosque case till Friday. The Supreme Court will hear the case at 3 pm tomorrow. Vishnu Shankar Jain, advocate of the Hindu side, told the Supreme Court that senior advocate Hari Shankar Jain is not well and requested it to hear the case tomorrow.

164.title: Russia uses new laser weapons in Ukraine, Zelenskyy mocks 'wonder weapon'
164.article_body: Russia has said it is using a new generation of powerful lasers in Ukraine to burn up drones. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy mockingly compared news of the lasers to the "wonder weapon" that Nazi Germany unveiled in a bid to prevent defeat in World War II. Russia's move "clearly indicates the complete failure of the invasion", Zelenskyy said.

165.title: Ridiculous: Cathie Wood on Tesla being cut from S&P 500 ESG Index
165.article_body: Ark Invest's Cathie Wood in response to Tesla being cut from the S&P 500 ESG Index, said, "Ridiculous. Not worthy of any other response." Responding to Wood, Musk wrote, "Yup. A clear case of wacktivism." "What I love most about wacktivists is their incredible sense of humour," he wrote in another tweet later.

166.title: How long can you hide truth?: RSS leader on Gyanvapi case
166.article_body: Speaking about the Gyanvapi Mosque case, RSS leader Sunil Ambekar said that facts should be allowed to come out. "Facts are coming out…In any case, truth always finds a way out. How long can you hide it?" Ambekar added. "I believe it's time we put historical facts in the right perspective before society," Ambekar stated.

167.title: Jaipur traffic policeman damages car’s windshield as driver jumps red light
167.article_body: A car’s windshield was damaged as a traffic policeman hit it with a stick after the driver jumped a red light in Jaipur’s Rambagh crossing on Wednesday, police said. A woman and a minor girl were also travelling in the car. Following the incident, a ruckus was created there. "Seven persons were arrested from the spot," a police official said.

168.title: Gyanvapi Mosque video survey report submitted in sealed cover in Varanasi court
168.article_body: The court-appointed Commission that conducted the video survey of the Gyanvapi Mosque complex has filed its report in a sealed cover in the Varanasi court on Thursday. Earlier, the Supreme Court had asked Varanasi District Magistrate to protect the area where the Shivling was claimed to have been found without affecting the right of Muslims to enter mosque and worship.

169.title: You call yourself sh*tposter, maybe you're wiseposter: Bezos to DOGE co-creator
169.article_body: Amazon's Jeff Bezos in response to a tweet by Dogecoin Co-creator Billy Markus said, "Seen you refer to yourself as...sh*tposter but maybe you're mostly just a wiseposter." Markus had tweeted about how Democrats and Republicans could pull more people to their side. Markus thanked Bezos and said he's addicted to dopamine and his tweets are just random thoughts he has.

170.title: Attempt to create panic: WB CM on Maoists posters in Jhargram
170.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that the posters put up with names of Maoists in Jhargram district are an attempt to create panic among the people. "Someone has been putting up handwritten posters claiming that it had been done by Maoists," Banerjee added. "There has been a continuous campaign and I think it must be investigated," Banerjee further said.

171.title: Katrina, Alia & I decided we want to do film together: Priyanka on Jee Le Zara
171.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra spoke about why she said yes to Farhan Akhtar's project, 'Jee Le Zara', which also stars actresses Katrina Kaif and Alia Bhatt. Priyanka said, "Katrina and Alia are two of the top actresses in the country." "The three of us decided we wanted to do a movie together and partner together to produce it," Priyanka said.

172.title: Shops in Mumbai to use Marathi signboards in Devanagari by May 31: BMC
172.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has directed all shops and establishments in Mumbai to predominantly use Marathi signboards in Devanagari script by May 31. While using more than one script, the Marathi-Devanagari script font cannot be smaller than that of other scripts, it added. Liquor shops or bars must not bear the names of legendary personalities and historical forts, BMC stated.

173.title: 65-year-old woman arrested for kidnapping 5-year-old boy in Thane
173.article_body: A 65-year-old woman has been arrested for allegedly kidnapping a five-year-old boy in Maharashtra's Thane district with the aim of selling him. The boy was kidnapped from near his house in Mafatlal slum area in Thane's Kalwa at around 10 pm on May 14. Police traced the woman within 48 hours and handed over the child to his parents.

174.title: Belarus introduces death penalty for 'attempted terrorism'
174.article_body: The Belarusian government has made 'attempted terrorism' punishable by death.
