He worked in different capacities for Google since 2013, before joining Apple in 2019. He's best known for inventing Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), a class of machine learning frameworks.

349.title: UFOs spotted 400 times by US military, reveals US govt
349.article_body: The US military has had 11 close encounters with UFOs, a top Pentagon intelligence official has told Congress. In the first public hearing of its kind in over half a century, intelligence chiefs revealed they had recorded around 400 UFO sightings in total. Senior Pentagon officials said no evidence of extraterrestrial origins had been discovered so far.

350.title: Everyone is newborn care specialist: Nick Jonas on receiving parenting advice
350.article_body: When asked if people have been giving him advice on how to care for his newborn daughter, Malti, singer Nick Jonas said, "Turns out everybody I know is a newborn care specialist, all these PhDs I didn't know they had." When asked how his brothers have reacted to the baby's arrival, Nick said, "Amazing. They got kids of their own."

351.title: Even the biggest of players can struggle: Ishan on his form in IPL 2022
351.article_body: Talking about his form in the ongoing IPL season, MI opener Ishan Kishan said that even the best of cricketers can "struggle" at some point. He added, "I have seen the likes of Chris Gayle taking time (to start hitting)...Some day, you get a good start, some day, opposition bowlers come prepared." Ishan has scored 370 runs in 13 games.

352.title: These allegations are written by BJP: Cong MP on Hardik’s resignation
352.article_body: Soon after Hardik Patel resigned from primary membership of Congress saying that the party only played the role of a "roadblock", party leader Shaktisinh Gohil said that these allegations are written down by BJP. These allegations have not been made by someone who has quit Congress, Gohil added. "They just speak it out loud," Gohil stated.

353.title: T'gana govt owes Hyd civic body ₹5,258 cr in property taxes: RTI reply
353.article_body: The Telangana government owes the Hyderabad civic body ₹5,258 crore in property taxes, as per an RTI response. Some of the dues are pending for nearly 25 years, The Print reported. The police department has not paid dues of ₹420 crore for 12 years and the medical department owes ₹1,185 crore over the last 23 years, the RTI reply added.

354.title: Apple delays plan requiring employees to come to office 3 days a week
354.article_body: Apple has delayed its plan that required its employees to come to the office three days a week, according to a memo seen by Bloomberg. Apple said that the requirement is being delayed "for the time being", without providing a new date. The technology company still requires its employees to come to the office two days a week.

355.title: Give central contract to Umran Malik straight away: Ravi Shastri
355.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said that the BCCI should give central contract to SRH fast bowler Umran Malik "straight away". "Don't let him float around...keep him in the mix with the main players and let him learn by being around the Shamis and Bumrahs," Shastri added about the 22-year-old cricketer, who is the fastest bowler in IPL 2022.

356.title: Russian gymnast Kuliak banned for 1 year for wearing 'Z' war symbol on chest at World Cup
356.article_body: Russian gymnast Ivan Kuliak has been given a one-year ban for wearing 'Z' national war symbol on the podium at Apparatus World Cup in Qatar in March. Kuliak earned bronze in parallel bars final and displayed a letter 'Z' taped to his chest as he stood next to gold medallist, Ukraine's Illia Kovtun. He'll also have to return his medal.

357.title: 'Excuse me?' Amber after Depp's lawyer claims she got Aquaman due to actor
357.article_body: Amber Heard has denied the claim that Johnny Depp got her the role of Mera in 'Aquaman'. Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez, while cross-examining Heard during the trial, suggested Amber got 'Aquaman' due to Depp. To this, Amber said, "Excuse me? No...I got myself that role by auditioning." Earlier, Amber had said she "fought hard" to stay in 'Aquaman 2'.

358.title: Won't arrest MP Navneet Rana, her husband till June 9: Mumbai Police
358.article_body: Mumbai Police told a court they would not arrest Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her MLA-husband Ravi Rana till June 9 in connection with Hanuman Chalisa case. June 9 is the date of hearing on police's plea seeking their bail cancellation. Rana and her husband were arrested after they had announced to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside Uddhav Thackeray's private residence.

359.title: No plans to block YouTube or cut ourselves off from internet: Russia
359.article_body: Russia's minister of communications Maksut Shadayev said Russia is not planning to shut YouTube in the country. He said that such a move would likely see Russian users suffer and should therefore be avoided. He added Russia doesn't want to cut itself off from global internet infrastructure, saying, "We think that Russia should remain a part of the global network."

360.title: Horatti resigns as chief of K'taka Legislative Council, joins BJP
360.article_body: Former senior JD(S) leader Basavaraj Horatti on Wednesday joined the BJP after resigning as the Chairman of Karnataka Legislative Council and MLC. He joined the BJP in the presence of Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai and BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi, among others. "[Horatti's] joining has strengthened the party...We'll...give him all the opportunities and respects he deserves," Bommai said.

361.title: Jamia Millia Islamia PG students stage protest against offline exams
361.article_body: A group of students pursuing postgraduate courses in Jamia Millia Islamia (JMI) on Tuesday gathered in front of the office of the university's proctor and staged a protest against offline exams. The students raised slogans demanding that exams should be conducted online. Meanwhile, the university said as classes were conducted offline, the exams will also be conducted in physical mode.

362.title: 2 sisters, mother poison family over their objection to girls' marriage with boyfriends
362.article_body: Noida police have arrested five people including two sisters, their mother and their boyfriends for allegedly attempting to poison their family. Police said the sisters laced the dinner of four family members with a poisonous substance because of their objection to their marriage with their boyfriends. The victims were rushed to hospital after another family member found them unconscious.

363.title: Johnny Depp smiles as Amber Heard's lawyer imitates his voice, video viral
363.article_body: In a video that has been shared by several internet users, Johnny Depp can be seen smiling after Amber Heard's lawyer is heard imitating his voice. While talking about Depp not looking at Amber during her testimony, Amber's attorney Elaine Bredehoft can be heard saying, "She played...a tape...where Johnny said, 'You will not see my...eyes again'. Do you...recall that?"

364.title: Ayodhya Ram temple construction on schedule, says authority
364.article_body: The construction of Ram Temple in Ayodhya is going as per schedule, an official statement said. Temple construction committee chairman Nripendra Misra said that the ground floor 'garbha griha' (sanctum sanctorum) will be complete by December 2023, while the remaining work will be done by December 2024. The construction of the plinth is expected to be completed by August 2022.

365.title: Ruchi Soya to acquire Patanjali's food retail business for ₹690 crore
365.article_body: Ruchi Soya on Wednesday said it'll be acquiring Patanjali Ayurved's food retail business for an amount of consideration of ₹690 crore. Post-acquisition, Ruchi Soya will be called 'Patanjali Foods' and will acquire Patanjali Ayurved's manufacturing plants in Padartha (Uttarakhand) and Newasa (Maharashtra). In 2019, Baba Ramdev's Patanjali had acquired Ruchi Soya through an insolvency process.

366.title: 4, including 2 children, missing from Pune found dead at Alibaug lodge
366.article_body: A 25-year-old woman, her two children, and a 29-year-old man who had gone missing from the Pune district on May 2 were found dead inside a tourist cottage in Alibaug on Tuesday afternoon. Police suspect the man and woman, who were allegedly in an extra-marital relationship, poisoned the three-year-old boy and five-year-old girl and then died by suicide by hanging.

367.title: LSG will undoubtedly target Shreyas with bouncers: Shastri
367.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said KKR captain Shreyas Iyer will have to "give himself time" to score runs in their final league match against LSG on Wednesday. Shastri added that LSG will "undoubtedly" target him with short balls and he'll have to show his "readiness against it". Shreyas is KKR's top run-getter with 351 runs in 13 games.

368.title: India test fires first indigenously developed naval anti-ship missile
368.article_body: Indian Navy on Wednesday successfully carried out the maiden test firing of the first indigenously developed naval anti-ship missile from a Seaking 42B helicopter, officials said. "This firing is a significant step towards achieving self-reliance in niche missile technology and reaffirms the Indian Navy's commitment to indigenisation," said a senior Navy official. The test was conducted in Odisha.

369.title: 2 booked for extortion threat of ₹10.85 crore to Pune builder
369.article_body: Pune's Hinjewadi Police have booked two persons for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹10.85 crore from a city-based builder. The accused, identified as Chandu Laxmandas Ramnani and Kiran Chandu Ramnani, allegedly accused the builder of committing fraud by not having disclosed type of land he was carrying out construction on. Police have booked the accused under relevant sections of IPC.

370.title: Registration for K'taka govt's mango farm trips to start soon: Official
370.article_body: The Karnataka State Mango Development and Marketing Corporation Limited will soon begin registration for mango-picking tourism on its website. Mango tours to farms will be held on Sundays wherein the corporation will take people to the mango farms in the Ramanagara or Kolar districts from Bengaluru. Farmers sell fruits at a lesser price during the tour, an official said.

371.title: I'm trying to learn from every situation: Rahul Tripathi on 76(44) vs MI
371.article_body: SRH batter Rahul Tripathi, who scored 76(44) against MI on Tuesday, said he enjoyed batting at number three and he's trying to learn from every situation. On facing Jasprit Bumrah, Tripathi said, "Bumrah's a great bowler...and I was just looking to react to whatever he's bowling. Depends on how the wicket is playing, how I can counterattack at that point."

372.title: Newly married man loses hand as gift from sister-in-law's ex-lover explodes in Gujarat
372.article_body: A newly married man and his three-year-old nephew were critically injured after a wedding gift, which he allegedly received from his sister-in-law's ex-boyfriend, exploded in Gujarat's Navsari district. Apart from suffering severe injuries to his arms, head and eyes, his right wrist was cut off from the arm. A police complaint has been filed by his family.

373.title: Fire breaks out near judges' chamber in Delhi court, no one injured
373.article_body: A fire broke out near a chamber of judges on the second floor of the Rohini Court in Delhi on Wednesday. No injuries were reported in the incident, officials said, adding that five fire tenders were sent to the spot. The blaze started in an air-conditioner in a room near the judges' chamber, Delhi Fire Service Director Atul Garg said.

374.title: Iran seizes foreign ship with smuggled fuel, detains crew members
374.article_body: Authorities in Iran have seized a foreign ship attempting to smuggle fuel out of the country and detained its crew members, state news agency IRNA reported on Wednesday. The ship, carrying over 5,50,000 litres of smuggled fuel, was seized in Gulf waters, the agency added. Iranian authorities have detained several ships in recent months for smuggling fuel in the Gulf.

375.title: Cong will be tail party in India, regional parties will take lead: TRS MLC
375.article_body: TRS MLC Kavitha Kalvakuntla reacted to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's remarks on regional parties and said his party will become a "tail party" in the country in future and regional parties will take lead. "Regional parties have a clear agenda for people. Rahulji should understand that even in Maharashtra they're in power because of a regional party there," Kavitha added.

376.title: One must do things the India way to be profitable there: Stellantis
376.article_body: Stellantis CEO Carlos Tavares has said that western automakers can be profitable in India if they do things the "India way". He added that amid global disruption in Europe and China, India has a "bigger opportunity" to grow in the global automotive industry as well as within Stellantis. The firm will be launching its first EV in India next year.

377.title: In extortion bid, 4 goons set petrol pump on fire in Bihar's Gaya
377.article_body: Four goons allegedly set a petrol pump afire in an extortion bid in Bihar's Gaya. According to the employees, the goons, who arrived on two bikes, asked them to fill their tanks and refused to pay. Instead, they demanded extortion from them. When denied, they set the pump's vending nozzles, a parked school bus and bike on fire and fled.

378.title: Gujarat Congress busy ensuring chicken sandwich delivery for Delhi leaders: Hardik
378.article_body: Hardik Patel, who resigned as Gujarat Congress working president and left the Congress party on Wednesday, in his resignation letter claimed that big Congress leaders in Gujarat were "far away from issues of Gujarat". He added, "They are more focussed on ensuring that chicken sandwich for leaders who have come from Delhi is delivered on time!"

379.title: Researcher shows way Teslas could be unlocked using vulnerability
379.article_body: NCC Group researcher Sultan Qasim Khan has demonstrated the way he unlocked a Tesla using a vulnerability he said Tesla has been informed about. He unlocked a 2020 Tesla Model 3 using a vulnerability in the BLE technology on which the entry system relies. He added any smart locks using BLE technology could be unlocked in the same way.

380.title: 2 friends drown in Saharanpur's Yamuna canal while bathing
380.article_body: Two friends reportedly drowned in the Yamuna canal at Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur, police said on Tuesday. Yuvraj (20) and Devesh (21), along with another person, went to take a bath in the canal but accidentally moved to the deeper side. While locals managed to save the third person, the two deceased were washed away in the strong current, police said.

381.title: Criticising RBI for delayed rate hike is unfair: Ex-RBI Governor
381.article_body: Ex-RBI Governor D Subbarao on Wednesday said criticism that RBI is behind the delayed interest rate hike is unfair. "With credit growth currently only around 9-10%, the recent repo rate hike is unlikely to transmit very strongly," Subbarao said. Unlike most large economies, India is structurally supply-constrained and that itself is a safety valve for India against stagflation, he added.

382.title: Heat wave warning issued for several states over 5 days, IMD releases list
382.article_body: The IMD has issued heat wave warning for several states over five days. Heat wave conditions will likely be witnessed in Rajasthan, Punjab, Haryana and Madhya Pradesh on May 19 and 20. Maharashtra will likely witness heat wave conditions from May 18 to 21. Meanwhile, heat wave conditions are likely in Uttar Pradesh today and over Odisha on May 22.

383.title: BJP trying to divert attention from unemployment, inflation: Mayawati on Gyanvapi case
383.article_body: Reacting to the Gyanvapi mosque controversy, BSP chief Mayawati said that BJP and its associates are targeting religious places to divert people's attention from unemployment and inflation. "Years after independence, the manner in which religious sentiments of people are being instigated under a conspiracy, under the pretext of Gyanvapi, Mathura...will not strengthen the country," she added.

384.title: Wall collapses at salt factory in Gujarat's Morbi, at least 12 workers killed
384.article_body: At least 12 labourers were killed after a wall of a salt factory collapsed in the Morbi district of Gujarat on Wednesday, an official said. Several people are feared trapped under the debris. A rescue operation has been started and the injured persons have been shifted to a nearby hospital.

385.title: Historic day: MP CM on SC's nod to OBC reservation in local body polls
385.article_body: Reacting to Supreme Court's decision giving approval to OBC reservation in MP's local body polls, CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said, "It's a historic day. Satyamev Jayate!" "It has been proven again that truth can't lose," he added. It was because of the Congress that it was earlier directed that polls would be held without OBC reservation, he further said.

386.title: Vedantu lays off 424 employees, CEO says 'I am truly sorry'
386.article_body: Bengaluru-based edtech startup Vedantu is laying off 424 of its 5,900 employees. "I am truly sorry," Vedantu CEO Vamsi Krishna told laid-off employees. In an e-mail to all Vedantu employees, he wrote, "External environment is tough. War in Europe, impending recession fears, and Fed rate interest hikes have led to inflationary pressures with massive correction in stocks...capital will be scarce."

387.title: Depp knows he's lying, I survived that man & I'm able to look at him: Amber
387.article_body: Amber Heard, when asked about Johnny Depp not looking at her during her testimony, said that he knows he is guilty and lying. "Otherwise why can't he look at me...I survived that man...and I'm able to look at him," Heard said. Depp's lawyer had asked Heard if it was true that actor promised that she'd never see his eyes again.

388.title: US approves COVID-19 vaccine booster for children aged 5 to 11
388.article_body: The United States has approved the administration of Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine booster dose for children aged from five to 11 years. The US Food and Drug Administration said that the move will provide continued protection against COVID-19. The children in this age group will be given a low-dose shot of 10 micrograms, compared to 30 microgram doses for older people.

389.title: We intend to close the transaction and enforce Musk merger agreement: Twitter board
389.article_body: Twitter Inc's board said it plans to enforce its $44 billion agreement to be bought by Elon Musk, saying the transaction is in the best interest of all shareholders. "We intend to close the transaction," the board said on Tuesday in a statement to Bloomberg News. The proposed takeover includes a $1 billion breakup fee for each party.

390.title: Plea seeking demolition of Gyanvapi Mosque wall to be heard today
390.article_body: A plea seeking the demolition of a wall beneath the wazu khana of the Gyanvapi Mosque will be heard by a Varanasi court on Wednesday. Advocate Vishnu Jain, appearing for the petitioners, said that they want the wall to be demolished and that they should be allowed to go there. He added the court will pronounce its verdict today itself.

391.title: I was named after Abhishek Bachchan, had to change my name due to him: Krushna
391.article_body: Comedian-actor Krushna Abhishek revealed his mother, who was Amitabh Bachchan's fan, named him after the actor's son, Abhishek Bachchan. He said, "My name had to be changed and made Krushna, also because of Abhishek." "When I got into acting, I was told there's...an actor by the name of Abhishek...they told me not to keep my name as Abhishek," he added.

392.title: UK MP arrested over rape & sex offences spanning 7 years
392.article_body: The UK Police have arrested an unnamed Conservative MP on suspicion of rape and sexual assault. The man is in his fifties and the investigation into the alleged offences, which took place between 2002 and 2009, is ongoing, police said. The man also faces allegations of abuse of position of trust and misconduct in a public office.

393.title: Rahul Tripathi has got some real potential: Matthew Hayden
393.article_body: Former Australia opener Matthew Hayden has praised SRH batter Rahul Tripathi, stating that the 31-year-old has "real potential to go all the way at the international level". Hayden added, "He is someone [who] is a dangerous striker of the ball, he can hit both sides of the wicket." Tripathi scored his third fifty of IPL 2022 against MI on Tuesday.

394.title: Video shows Heard, Franco in elevator night before she filed for divorce from Depp
394.article_body: Footage has emerged of Hollywood actor James Franco visiting Amber Heard at her apartment the night before she filed for divorce from Johnny Depp. The footage, showing Heard and Franco in an elevator, was played to jurors in the courthouse. Heard confirmed that it was Franco in the video and that they were going to her penthouse.

395.title: I used to pull a truck for 8 km: Shoaib Akhtar on how he breached 160-kmph bowling speed
395.article_body: Talking about how he breached 160-kmph bowling speed, former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar said that he used to pull vehicles. "I began by running with tyres...Next, I started pulling small vehicles with my shoulders...[at night in Islamabad]," he added. He further said, "I started pulling a truck. I used to pull a truck for around 8 km."

396.title: Hyd-based devotee donates gold band worth ₹2 cr to Shirdi Saibaba Temple
396.article_body: A Hyderabad-based devotee has donated a band made of 4 kg of gold worth ₹2 crore to the Saibaba Temple in Maharashtra's Shirdi, the temple authorities said on Wednesday. The devotee, Parthsarthi Reddy, wished to donate the band for the throne of Saibaba's idol at the temple in 2016, but the procedure got delayed, the authorities added.

397.title: 'Narco tunnel' with a rail line uncovered between Mexico & US
397.article_body: US anti-narcotics agents have discovered a "narco tunnel" running from Mexico's Tijuana to a warehouse in US' San Diego. The tunnel, estimated to be about 1,744 feet long, had a rail track, electricity and a ventilation system. The agents were carrying out surveillance at a property previously used as a stash house for smuggling cocaine when they made the discovery.

398.title: Bus CCTV camera captures moment 2 buses collide head-on in Tamil Nadu, 30 injured
398.article_body: Around 30 people were injured in a head-on collision between two buses in Tamil Nadu's Salem district. The footage from the CCTV camera installed inside one of the buses, showing the collision, has gone viral. The video shows the bus driver thrown out of his seat while another man is seen hitting the windshield of the bus after the crash.

399.title: Anurag had told me 'Stop doubting yourself, you're good': Fatima on self-doubt
399.article_body: Actress Fatima Sana Shaikh said that filmmaker Anurag Kashyap told her to "stop doubting" herself during the film 'Ludo'. "Dada had given me some sense of confidence...He used to tell me...you're good," she said, adding that she had self doubt during 'Modern Love: Mumbai', but director Shonali Bose said she was doing well.

400.title: Painting exchanged for cheese sandwich sold at auction for over ₹2 crore in Canada
400.article_body: A Canadian painting by artist Maud Lewis has been sold at an auction for CA$350,000 (over ₹2 crore) after coming to its owner in exchange for a grilled cheese sandwich. The painting was acquired by a chef named Irene Demas in the year 1973. "Mind you...It was a great sandwich, with a five-year-old cheddar and beautiful bread," Demas said.

401.title: Bus rams into truck on Yamuna Expressway in UP; 3 killed, 36 injured
401.article_body: A bus carrying 60 people rammed into a truck on the Yamuna Expressway in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura leaving three dead and injuring 36 others, police said. The passengers were returning to Delhi after offering prayers in Vrindavan, police added. The bus rammed into the truck laden with building material from behind, police further said.

402.title: US planning military aid package for India to reduce India's dependence on Russia: Report
402.article_body: US is preparing a military aid package for India to reduce the country's dependence on Russian weapons, according to a report quoting people familiar with the matter said. The package under consideration would include foreign military financing of as much as $500 million, the report added. However, it is unclear when the deal would be announced.
